meanings.sent1: The transverses line divided the field into two equal parts.
meanings.sent2: The transverses stripes on the shirt made it look stylish.
meanings.sent3: The transverses bridge connected the two sides of the river with ease.
meanings.sent4: Her transverses glance caught the attention of everyone in the room.
meanings.sent5: The transverses shadow of the tree stretched across the grass.

meanings.definition: To go or extend across or over; cross.
meanings.sent1: The hiker transverses the mountain to reach the other side.
meanings.sent2: The road transverses through the forest, offering a scenic drive.
meanings.sent3: The cat transverses the room in search of its favorite toy.
meanings.sent4: His words transverses the barriers of language and culture.
meanings.sent5: The river transverses the valley, bringing life to the land.
